intro: Sideritis lagascana, commonly known as Greek ladies' fingers, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes herbs such as mint and basil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sideritis lagascana is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
